Classes

AreaPerLipid(universe, lipid_sel, leaflets)

Calculate the area of lipids in each leaflet of a bilayer.

AssignLeaflets(universe, lipid_sel[, ...])

Assign lipids in a bilayer to the upper leaflet, lower leaflet, or midplane.

BayesianOptimizer(objective_function, bounds)

Implements Bayesian Optimization using Gaussian Processes (GP) to find the minimum of an objective function.

ConstantKernel([constant_value, ...])

Constant kernel.

DiffusionCalculator(topology, trajectory[, ...])

EinsteinMSD(u[, select, msd_type, fft])

Class to calculate Mean Squared Displacement by the Einstein relation.

GaussianProcessRegressor([kernel, alpha, ...])

Gaussian process regression (GPR).

GeneticOptimizer(objective_function, bounds)

Implements a Genetic Algorithm (GA) for optimization.

LossRecorder()

A class to record and retrieve losses for various terms across iterations during a training process.

MSD(universe, lipid_sel[, com_removal_sel, dt])

Calculate the mean-squared lateral displacement of lipids in a bilayer.

Matern([length_scale, length_scale_bounds, nu])

Matern kernel.

MembThickness(universe, lipid_sel, leaflets)

Calculate the bilayer thickness.

MembraneProperties(topology, trajectory[, ...])

OptParametersProcess(system_topology, ...[, ...])

A class to manage the optimization of parameters within molecular dynamics simulations.

Particle(bounds[, init_position])

Represents a single particle in the Particle Swarm Optimization (PSO) algorithm.

ParticleSwarmOptimizer(objective_function, ...)

Implements the Particle Swarm Optimization (PSO) algorithm for finding the minimum of an objective function in a multi-dimensional space.

ProcessPoolExecutor([max_workers, ...])

RDF(topology, trajectory[, begin_frame_id, ...])

SimplexOptimizer(objective_function, bounds)

Implements the Nelder-Mead simplex algorithm for optimization.

ThreadPoolExecutor([max_workers, ...])

WhiteKernel([noise_level, noise_level_bounds])

White kernel.

This method is a heuristic search algorithm that can be used to find the minimum or maximum of an objective function in a multidimensional space. It is particularly useful for optimization problems where the objective function is non-differentiable, discontinuous, or noisy."]; }
